Title: Large Monochromatic Triple Stars in Edge Colourings
Abstract: © 2015 Wiley Periodicals, Inc.Following problems posed by Gyárfás 2011, we show that for every r-edge-colouring of Kn there is a monochromatic triple star of order at least n/(r-1), improving Ruszinkõ's result 2012. An edge colouring of a graph is called a local r-colouring if every vertex spans edges of at most r distinct colours. We prove the existence of a monochromatic triple star with at least rn/(r2-r+1) vertices in every local r-colouring of Kn.
